item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test: AUS 127/1 vs IND at Melbourne - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test: AUS 140/1 vs IND at Melbourne

Date: Thursday, December 14, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Australia is in a dominant position at 140/1 on Day 1 of the fourth Test against India, thanks to a solid performance by Sam Konstas, who scored a half-century on his debut.

  • Australia made changes with Sam Konstas making his Test debut and Scott Boland replacing injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • India's Shubman Gill was replaced by Washington Sundar in the playing XI.
  • Rohit Sharma confirmed he will open the innings for India.
  • The match is part of the Border Gavaskar Trophy series.
“Sam Konstas is set to take make his debut for Australia.”

This match marks a critical point in the series as both teams aim to secure victory in the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

item.title: Japan airlines hit by massive cyberattack, flights affected: All you need to know - The Times of India
item.description:
Japan Airlines Affected by Major Cyberattack, Flights Disrupted

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: News Agency

Japan Airlines has experienced a significant cyberattack that led to numerous flight disruptions. The incident raised concerns over airline security protocols and passenger safety.

  • Cyberattack resulted in cancellation of several flights.
  • Customers expressed frustration and confusion over sudden changes.
  • Investigation launched to identify the source and impact of the attack.
“This is a wake-up call for the aviation industry regarding cybersecurity measures.” - Cybersecurity Expert

The airline industry faces increasing scrutiny regarding cybersecurity as incidents like this highlight vulnerabilities that could affect millions of passengers worldwide.

item.title: Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses a physical confrontation between Virat Kohli and debutant Sam Konstas during the first day of the India vs Australia Test match in Melbourne. The incident drew criticism from former players Ricky Ponting and Michael Vaughan, who called for the ICC match referee to take action.

  • The altercation happened after the 10th over when Kohli and Konstas crossed paths on the field.
  • Former players Vaughan and Ponting remarked on Kohli's role in instigating the confrontation.
  • Despite the clash, Konstas continued to perform well, scoring a half-century on his debut.
  • Konstas is recognized as Australia's fourth youngest Test debutant.
“Virat has walked one whole pitch over to his right and instigated that confrontation.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the pressures of competitive cricket and the scrutiny players face from former professionals and fans alike.

item.title: ​6 must-do tips to avoid damaging your eyes with age - The Times of India
item.description:
6 Must-Do Tips to Avoid Eye Damage as You Age

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

As we age, our eyes undergo significant wear and tear, compounded by screen time and environmental factors. Here are effective strategies to protect your vision.

  • Follow the 20-20-20 rule for screen time.
  • Incorporate an eye-friendly diet rich in superfoods.
  • Practice eye yoga for relaxation and strength.
  • Protect your eyes from UV radiation.
  • Avoid overusing eye drops to prevent dependency.
  • Schedule regular eye check-ups to catch issues early.
“The retina of a 60-year-old typically receives one-third the light of a 20-year-old's retina.”

By adopting these habits, you can maintain eye health and prevent age-related vision problems.

item.title: Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV

During the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, Australian debutant Sam Konstas fiercely batted against India, leading to a heated exchange with Virat Kohli. Kohli attempted to unsettle Konstas, but the young batter remained unfazed and scored a half-century.

  • Sam Konstas scored a 52-ball half-century on his debut.
  • Kohli reportedly pushed Konstas in an attempt to distract him.
  • The altercation did not impact Konstas' performance.
  • Konstas became the fourth youngest Test debutant for Australia.
  • Konstas has impressive stats in his first-class career, including two centuries.
“Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas exchanged a heated moment on the MCG.” — cricket.com.au

This incident highlights the intensity of competitive sports and the pressure on debutants at the international level.

item.title: Rajasthan man takes voluntary retirement to care for wife, she dies at his farewell party. Video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rajasthan Man's Farewell Party Turns Tragic as Wife Dies Suddenly

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A farewell party for Devendra Sandal, a government employee in Rajasthan, turned tragic when his wife, Deepika, collapsed and died in front of him. The couple was celebrating Devendra's voluntary retirement aimed at caring for Deepika, who had heart issues.

  • Devendra took early retirement to care for his 50-year-old wife, who had been suffering from heart-related problems.
  • The incident occurred at Devendra's farewell party at the Central Warehouse in Kota.
  • A video of the event has been shared on social media, capturing the moment before the tragedy unfolded.
  • Deepika showed signs of discomfort during the function, which led to her collapse.
  • Despite immediate attempts to help her, she was declared dead upon arrival at the hospital.
“Paani le aao, chakkar aa rahe honge.” (bring water, she might be feeling dizzy)

This heartbreaking incident highlights the unpredictability of life and the suddenness of loss, serving as a poignant reminder of the fragility of health.

item.title: Azerbaijan Airlines plane crash: Passenger captures moments of horror before and after mishap in Kazakhstan | Videos - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Azerbaijan Airlines Plane Crash: Eyewitness Footage Captures Moments of Horror

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

An Embraer 190 jet traveling from Baku, Azerbaijan to Grozny, Russia crashed near Kazakhstan's Aktau after being rerouted due to fog.

  • The aircraft was carrying 62 passengers and 5 crew members.
  • 29 survivors were rescued while the death toll stood at 38.
  • The crash was reportedly caused by a potential bird strike, according to initial reports.
  • Footage from passengers depicted chaotic scenes, including injuries and pleas for help.
  • The plane deviated from its original flight path, crossing the Caspian Sea before the crash.
“I'll never forget their look, full of pain and despair,” said a witness who helped survivors.

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for investigations into flight safety and emergency protocols.

item.title: For SRF, there’s no light at the end of tunnel yet | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
For SRF, there’s no light at the end of tunnel yet

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

The growth catalyst for SRF Ltd is absent in the December quarter following a weak performance in H1FY25, with a notable decline in revenue from its chemicals business.

  • Revenue from the chemicals sector, which made up 41% of H1 revenue, dropped by 8% year-on-year.
  • The segment is affected by a slowdown in the global agrochemical market and high inventory levels among customers.
  • Other contributing factors include weak exports of refrigerant gases and pricing pressure from cheaper agrochemical supplies from China.
“The segment continues to suffer from the global agrochemical market slowdown due to elevated inventory levels at customers' end.”

In summary, SRF Ltd is facing significant challenges in the chemicals market, indicating a tough outlook for the near term.

item.title: After Panama Canal, Trump Threatens To Buy Greenland Again, What's His Fixation With The Island? - News18
item.description:
Trump Revives Interest in Acquiring Greenland, Citing National Security

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: News18

Former President Donald Trump has once again expressed interest in purchasing Greenland, initially proposed in 2019 as a real estate deal. This time, he emphasizes national security concerns as the rationale for US control of the island.

  • Trump states that ownership of Greenland is necessary for U.S. national security.
  • Greenland's Prime Minister has firmly indicated that the island is “not for sale.”
  • The U.S. has historical precedent for interest in acquiring Greenland, dating back to earlier presidencies.
  • Geopolitical tensions, particularly with China and Russia, increase the strategic importance of Greenland.
“For purposes of National Security and Freedom throughout the World, the United States of America feels that the ownership and control of Greenland is an absolute necessity.” - Donald Trump

Trump's proposal reflects his inclination toward a transactional approach to international relations, underscoring ongoing geopolitical dynamics and resource interests in the Arctic region.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill misses out, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill dropped, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India

Publication Date: December 29, 2023

Source: Times of India

Australia won the toss and opted to bat first in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). India made a notable change by dropping Shubman Gill and including Washington Sundar in the lineup.

  • Rohit Sharma confirmed the team change, emphasizing the team's readiness to compete in a close series (1-1).
  • Pat Cummins expressed confidence in batting first, noting the good condition of the pitch with some grass.
  • The series remains competitive following India’s previous win and Australia’s victory in the second Test.
“We would have batted as well, looks like a good wicket. The series is 1-1, a lot to play for.” - Rohit Sharma

The Boxing Day Test is crucial for both teams as they aim for series victory following an exciting draw in the previous match.

item.title: Maharashtra Contract Employee Stole Rs 21 Crore From Govt; Bought BMW, Gifted 4BHK To Girlfriend - News18
item.description:
Maharashtra Contract Employee Stole Rs 21 Crore From Govt; Bought BMW, Gifted 4BHK To Girlfriend

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: News18

A government contractual employee in Maharashtra allegedly defrauded Rs 21 crore from the sports complex administration, using forged documents and internet banking. This scandal led to an extravagant lifestyle that left acquaintances bewildered.

  • The accused, Harsh Kumar Kshirsagar, was on a salary of Rs 13,000.
  • Kshirsagar and an accomplice misappropriated government funds through an internet banking scheme.
  • They purchased luxury items including a BMW car and gifted a 4 BHK flat to Kshirsagar's girlfriend.
  • Investigations revealed the involvement of other contract employees in the fraudulent activity.
  • The scam was discovered six months after it began.
"The departmental deputy director only detected the fraudulent activity six months later."

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities within government systems, prompting calls for stricter controls and audits to prevent such occurrences in the future.

item.title: Trade Setup for December 26: Volatility, low volumes to dominate Nifty moves on final expiry of 2024 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Market Update for December 26: Nifty Faces Volatility Ahead of Expiry

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty struggled to maintain its momentum, closing at 23,727.65 after early gains were overshadowed by selling pressure. Looking ahead, the market is in a sideways-to-bearish trend with significant sector performance fluctuations.

  • Nifty closed 0.11% down, affected by volatile trading.
  • Metal stocks emerged as the top losers after a prior rally.
  • Tata Group stocks surged by up to 13% amid IPO speculation.
  • Market outlook depends on upcoming quarterly results and the Union Budget.
  • Foreign institutions were net sellers while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • Nifty's immediate resistance at 23,900-24,000, support at 23,500.
“The near-term market trajectory hinges on the outcome of the third quarter results and the Union Budget.” - Vinod Nair, Geojit Financial Services

The market is expected to remain cautious with pressures from high bond yields and a strong dollar.

item.title: India Cements' Srinivasan exits co after Birla takeover - The Times of India
item.description:
India Cements' Srinivasan exits company following Birla takeover

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: The Economic Times

In a notable shift in corporate leadership, the chairman of India Cements, N. Srinivasan, has stepped down from his position following the acquisition of the company by the Aditya Birla Group.

  • N. Srinivasan's departure marks the end of an era for India Cements, which he led for several decades.
  • The acquisition by the Aditya Birla Group is seen as a strategic move to expand their footprint in the cement industry.
  • This takeover has significant implications for the future direction of India Cements amidst evolving market dynamics.
“The acquisition will enhance our operations and provide synergies in the cement sector,” said a spokesperson from the Aditya Birla Group.

This transition is expected to bring new challenges and opportunities for both India Cements and the Aditya Birla Group as they navigate the competitive landscape of the cement industry.

item.title: ​Pet food recalled after Washington County cat dies of bird flu - The Times of India
item.description:
Pet Food Recall Due to Bird Flu Linked to Cat Death in Washington County

Publication Date: Tuesday, October 17, 2023
Source: Oregon Department of Agriculture

The Washington State Department of Agriculture announced a recall of Northwest Naturals' pet food after a cat in Washington County died from H5N1 bird flu, with tests confirming the cat contracted the virus through the pet food.

  • The recalled product is Northwest Naturals 2lb Feline Turkey Recipe raw and frozen pet food.
  • The recall was prompted by the death of an indoor cat confirmed to be infected with the H5N1 strain of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI).
  • Genome sequencing indicated an exact match between the virus in the pet food and the infected cat.
  • The recall affects products with “Best if used by” dates of 05/21/26 B10 and 06/23/26 B1.
  • The food was distributed nationwide, including in states such as Arizona, California, and Florida, as well as British Columbia.
  • No human cases linked to this incident have been reported.
“We are confident that this cat contracted H5N1 by eating the Northwest Naturals raw and frozen pet food.” - Dr. Ryan Scholz, Oregon Department of Agriculture state veterinarian

The Oregon Department of Agriculture has recommended guidelines to prevent the spread of the disease.

An act of kindness from Allu Arjun's father, who gifted a 2 crore cheque to a boy injured in a recent stampede, has garnered attention.

  • Allu Arjun's father, Allu Aravind, provided financial support to the family of the injured child.
  • The donation is intended to assist with medical expenses and recovery.
  • This gesture has been praised as a significant act of compassion amidst the tragedy.
“We hope this helps in the recovery and brings some comfort to the family,” said Allu Aravind.

This generous contribution highlights the impact of celebrity influence in charitable acts, particularly in times of community distress.

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

item.title: US News Today Live Updates on December 26, 2024 : How did NASA astronauts get Christmas decorations in space? Social media wants answers | Today News - Mint
item.description:
US News Today Live Updates on December 26, 2024: How did NASA astronauts get Christmas decorations in space? Social media wants answers

Published on: 26 Dec, 2024 by LiveMint

NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams brought Christmas cheer to the International Space Station (ISS), raising questions on social media regarding the logistics of getting festive decorations into space.

  • Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams brought Christmas cheer to the ISS, donning Santa hats despite being stranded in orbit since June. Social media buzzed with playful questions about how festive decorations made it on their originally short mission, sparking intrigue about space logistics.
“In today’s dynamic landscape, staying updated on the latest developments across the United States is essential,” the report states.

This event highlights the unique blend of human experience and space exploration, reminding us of the personal connections that endure even in the most challenging environments.

item.title: MT Vasudevan Nair: Celebrated Indian author dies at 91 - BBC.com
item.description:
MT Vasudevan Nair: Celebrated Indian Author Dies at 91

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Outlook India

MT Vasudevan Nair, a legendary writer from Kerala, has passed away at the age of 91 after being admitted to a hospital for breathing difficulties. Nair was not only a celebrated author but also an acclaimed film director and screenwriter.

  • Nair was born in 1933 in Palakkad, Kerala, and began writing from a young age despite minimal encouragement in his family.
  • He achieved significant acclaim for his novel Naalukettu, which won one of Kerala's highest literary honours in 1959.
  • His retelling of the Mahabharata in Randamoozham is regarded as a classic of Indian literature.
  • Nair was awarded India's highest literary honour, the Jnanpith, among other accolades during his career.
  • He also had a prolific career in Malayalam cinema, noted for his screenplay in Oru Vadakkan Veeragatha.
  • Tributes have poured in highlighting his impact on Malayalam literature and cinema.
"You can change the dialogues of any other films, but not MT's, since those dialogues are essential to understand the essence of what is being conveyed." - Mohanlal

Nair's legacy lives on through his extensive body of work, influencing generations of writers and filmmakers.
